qas.question: What is the term used to test software during a pre-release?
What does Operational Acceptance focus on?
What is Operational Acceptance limited to while testing?

answers.text: limited to those tests which are required to verify the non-functional aspects of the system

plausible_answers.text: to conduct operational readiness (pre-release) of a product, service or system as part of a quality management system.

qas.question: What is Occupational Acceptance used for?
What is an uncommon type of functional software testing?

plausible_answers.text: limited to those tests which are required to verify the non-functional aspects of the system.

qas.question: What is Operational Acceptance limited to while running?

plausible_answers.text: the operational readiness of the system to be supported, and/or to become part of the production environment.

qas.question: OAT focuses the least on what?

context: <a0_0>Operational Acceptance<a0_0/> is used <b3_0>to conduct operational readiness (pre-release) of a product, service or system as part of a quality management system.<b3_0/> <b4_0>OAT<b4_0/> is a common type of non-functional software testing, used mainly in software development and software maintenance projects. This type of testing focuses on <b6_0>the <a1_0>operational readiness of the system<a1_0/> to be supported, and/or to become part of the production environment.<b6_0/> Hence, it is also known as operational readiness testing (ORT) or Operations readiness and assurance (OR&A) testing. Functional testing within OAT is <a2_0><b5_0>limited to those tests which are required to verify the non-functional aspects of the system<a2_0/>.
